Bezer in the wilderness, in the region of the plateau, for the Reubenites; Ramoth in Gilead for the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan for the Manassites.
But his servant objected, “How can I set this before a hundred?” Elisha again said, “Give it to the people to eat, for thus says the LORD: You will eat and have some left over.”
They attacked the surviving Amalekites who had escaped, and have lived there to the present day.
these purified the sanctuary and carried away the stones of the defilement to an unclean place.
Charges about this affair were brought against Menelaus.
But he said to them, “To the other towns also I must proclaim the good news of the kingdom of God, because for this purpose I have been sent.”
Return to Galilee. After the two days, he left there for Galilee.
